docs.title: HDsEMG Data Cleaning Tool
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation for hdsemg-select, a sophisticated graphical user interface (GUI) application designed for selecting and analyzing HDsEMG channels from .mat files. This tool helps identify and exclude faulty channels (e.g., due to electrode misplacement or corrosion) and automatically flag potential artifacts like ECG contamination, power line noise (50/60Hz), or general signal anomalies.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• ✅ Support for multiple file formats (.mat, .otb+, .otb4)
  • 🧠 Intelligent grid detection and configuration
  • 🖼 Comprehensive visualization tools
  • ⚡️ Advanced artifact detection
  • 💾 Structured data export
  • 🔍 Detailed signal analysis capabilities

docs.title: Quick Navigation
docs.text:
• Installation Guide: Step-by-step instructions for setting up hdsemg-select
  • Usage Guide: Learn how to use the application effectively
  • Developer Guide: Information for contributors and developers

docs.title: Signal Visualization
docs.text:
• Grid-based electrode visualization
  • Time-domain and frequency spectrum analysis
  • Multi-channel overview with pagination
  • Reference signal overlay capabilities

docs.title: Channel Management
docs.text:
• Manual and automatic channel selection
  • Amplitude-based selection with configurable thresholds
  • Custom label management
  • Comprehensive artifact flagging system

docs.title: Data Processing
docs.text:
• Automatic artifact detection
    • ECG contamination identification
    • Power line noise detection (50/60Hz)
    • General signal anomaly detection
  • Signal view options (MP, SD, DD)
  • Action potential propagation analysis

docs.title: Data Export
docs.text:
• Structured JSON export with channel metadata
  • Automated cleaned .mat file generation
  • Comprehensive channel labeling system

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.8+
  • See requirements.txt for detailed dependencies
  • Compatible with Linux and Windows 11

docs.title: Related Tools
docs.text:
• hdsemg-pipe App 🧼
  • hdsemg-shared 📦
  • openhdemg 🧬

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
Contributions are welcome! If you'd like to improve hdsemg-select, please feel free to:

  • Submit pull requests
  • Report issues
  • Suggest new features

Visit our GitHub repository to get started.

docs.title: Developer Guide
docs.text: This guide provides information for developers who want to contribute to or modify the hdsemg-select application.

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
src/
├── __init__.py
├── main.py                 # Application entry point
├── version.py             # Version information
├── _log/                  # Logging configuration
├── config/               # Application configuration
├── controller/           # Application controllers
├── helper/              # Utility functions
├── select_logic/        # Core selection algorithms
├── settings/           # Settings management
├── state/              # Application state management
└── ui/                 # User interface components

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Set up your development environment following the Installation Guide
  3. Install additional development dependencies: bash pip install pytest pytest-cov pylint

docs.title: Coding Standards
docs.text:
• Follow PEP 8 style guide
  • Write docstrings for all public methods
  • Maintain type hints
  • Keep methods focused and single-responsibility
  • Write unit tests for new features

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text: python -m pytest

docs.title: Test Coverage
docs.text: python -m pytest --cov=src

docs.title: Resource Compilation
docs.text:
cd src
pyrcc5 resources.qrc -o resources_rc.py

docs.title: Creating Executables
docs.text:
• Windows: bash pyinstaller src/hdsemg-select-win.spec
  • macOS: bash pyinstaller src/hdsemg-select-macos.spec

docs.title: Signal Processing
docs.text:
• Located in select_logic/data_processing.py
  • Handles raw signal manipulation
  • Implements filtering algorithms

docs.title: Artifact Detection
docs.text:
• Located in select_logic/auto_flagger.py
  • ECG contamination detection
  • Power line noise identification
  • Custom artifact detection algorithms

docs.title: UI Components
docs.text:
• Based on PyQt5
  • Custom widgets in ui/widgets/
  • Plot components using pyqtgraph

docs.title: Pull Request Process
docs.text:
1. Create a feature branch
  2. Implement changes
  3. Add/update tests
  4. Update documentation
  5. Submit PR with description

docs.title: Version Control
docs.text:
• Use semantic versioning
  • Update version.py
  • Document changes in CHANGELOG.md

docs.title: Data Flow
docs.text:
1. File Loading → Grid Detection → Signal Processing
  2. User Interface ←→ State Management
  3. Selection Logic → Data Export

docs.title: State Management
docs.text:
• Centralized state in state/state.py
  • Event-driven updates
  • PyQt signals and slots

docs.title: Large Dataset Handling
docs.text:
• Implement pagination
  • Use memory-efficient data structures
  • Consider chunked processing

docs.title: Optimization Tips
docs.text:
• Profile code using cProfile
  • Optimize heavy computations
  • Use NumPy for array operations

docs.title: Logging
docs.text:
• Configure in _log/log_config.py
  • Use appropriate log levels
  • Include context in log messages

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
• Resource compilation errors
  • Memory management
  • Qt event loop issues

docs.title: Planned Features
docs.text:
• Additional file format support
  • Enhanced artifact detection
  • Performance optimizations
  • Extended analysis tools

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text:
1. Improve automatic detection
  2. Add batch processing
  3. Implement additional exports
  4. Enhance visualization options

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide will walk you through the process of installing and setting up hdsemg-select on your system.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Before installing hdsemg-select, ensure you have: - Python 3.8 or higher installed - Git installed on your system - Administrator access (for virtual environment creation)

docs.title: 1. Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/johanneskasser/hdsemg-select.git
cd hdsemg-select

docs.title: 2. Set Up Virtual Environment
docs.text: You have two options for setting up your development environment:

docs.title: Option 1: Using Python venv
docs.text:
# Run as administrator
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows use venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Option 2: Using Conda
docs.text:
conda env create -f environment.yml
conda activate hdsemg-select

docs.title: 3. Compile Resource File
docs.text:
Navigate to the source directory and compile the resource file:

cd ./src
pyrcc5 resources.qrc -o resources_rc.py

docs.title: 4. Launch the Application
docs.text:
Run the main Python script to start the application:

python main.py

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
1. Virtual Environment Creation Fails
  2. Ensure you're running the command prompt as administrator

  3. Verify Python is correctly installed and in your system PATH

  4. Missing Dependencies

  5. Try reinstalling requirements: pip install -r requirements.txt

  6. Check for any error messages during installation

  7. Resource Compilation Error

  8. Ensure PyQt5 is properly installed
  9. Verify the resources.qrc file exists in the src directory

docs.title: System Compatibility
docs.text:
The application has been tested on: - Windows 11 - Linux distributions

For platform-specific issues, please check our GitHub issues page.

docs.title: Usage Guide
docs.text: This guide covers the main functionality of hdsemg-select and how to effectively use its features.

docs.title: Supported File Formats
docs.text:
• .mat files
  • .otb+ files
  • .otb4 files

docs.title: Loading Data
docs.text:
1. Go to "File" -> "Open..."
  2. Select your data file
  3. The application will attempt to auto-detect the grid configuration

docs.title: Automatic Grid Detection
docs.text: The application automatically detects: - Grid size - Inter-electrode distance - Channel arrangement

docs.title: Manual Configuration
docs.text: If automatic detection fails: 1. Use the manual grid configuration dialog 2. Set rows and columns 3. Define inter-electrode distance 4. Specify orientation (parallel/perpendicular to muscle fibers)

docs.title: Manual Selection
docs.text:
• Use checkboxes to mark channels as "good"
  • Click individual channels in the Electrode Widget
  • Toggle selection status in the detailed view

docs.title: Automatic Selection
docs.text: Access via "Automatic Selection" menu: - Select All: Toggle all channels - Amplitude Based: Select channels based on configurable thresholds

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. Navigate to "File" -> "Settings"
  2. Select "Automatic Channel Flagging Settings" tab
  3. Configure:
  4. Frequency thresholds
  5. Variance thresholds
  6. Frequency bands
  7. ECG detection parameters
  8. Power line noise detection (50Hz/60Hz)

docs.title: Running Artifact Detection
docs.text:
1. Load your data file
  2. Go to "Automatic Selection" -> "Suggest Artifact Flags..."
  3. Review suggested flags in:
  4. Channel widgets
  5. Detailed view
  6. Manually adjust flags if needed

docs.title: Dashboard View
docs.text:
• File metadata
  • Channel statistics
  • Selection count
  • Sampling rate information

docs.title: Electrode Widget
docs.text:
• Numbered channel display
  • Selection status indicators
  • Channel flag visualization
  • Grid orientation controls

docs.title: Detail Viewer
docs.text:
• Time-domain signal plots
  • Frequency spectrum analysis
  • Channel-specific metrics
  • Flag/label management

docs.title: Signal Overview
docs.text:
• Amplitude-normalized channel display
  • Action potential propagation visualization
  • Row/column bold line emphasis
  • Signal view options:
  • Monopolar (MP)
  • Single Differential (SD)
  • Double Differential (DD)

docs.title: JSON Export
docs.text:
1. Select "File" -> "Save Selection"
  2. Choose save location
  3. Exported data includes:
  4. Channel selection status
  5. Artifact flags
  6. Grid configuration
  7. Channel metadata

docs.title: Cleaned Data Export
docs.text:
• Automatically generates cleaned .mat files
  • Options to exclude:
  • Selected channels
  • Flagged channels
  • Custom labeled channels

docs.title: Large File Handling
docs.text:
• Warning messages for large files
  • Abort option during loading
  • Pagination for better performance
  • Memory usage optimization

docs.title: Efficient Navigation
docs.text:
• Use page navigation for large datasets
  • Utilize thumbnails for quick overview
  • Apply filters to manage large channel counts
